Package io.papermc.paper.entity.damage

Interface DamageOrigin

All Known Subinterfaces:
BadRespawnPointDamageOrigin, EntityDamageOrigin, IndirectEntityDamageOrigin
public interface DamageOrigin
A damage origin also known as damage source and damage cause is a label that describes in what way an entity has been damaged. This is notably used to know the death message, the sound effect, the potential knock-back applied and much more...
There are three types of damage
  • DamageOrigin
  • EntityDamageOrigin (related to an entity)
  • IndirectEntityDamageOrigin (related to an entity and a direct source)

This new API is a replacement of the old bukkit DamageCause API

See Also:
  • EntityDamageEvent.DamageCause

  • Method Details

    • of

      @NotNull static @NotNull DamageOriginBuilder of(@NotNull @NotNull String name)
      Creates a generic DamageOriginBuilder without specify any entity related to the damage.
      Parameters:
      name - The name, or by default the translation key used for death message
      Returns:
      A builder to then build a new DamageOrigin

    • entitySource

      @NotNull static @NotNull EntityDamageOriginBuilder entitySource(@NotNull @NotNull String name, @NotNull @NotNull Entity source)
      Creates a generic EntityDamageOriginBuilder with an entity related to the damage.
      Parameters:
      name - The name, or by default the translation key used for death message
      source - The entity source
      Returns:
      A builder to then build a new EntityDamageOrigin

    • indirectEntitySource

      @NotNull static @NotNull IndirectEntityDamageOriginBuilder indirectEntitySource(@NotNull @NotNull String name, @NotNull @NotNull Entity directSource, @Nullable @Nullable Entity source)
      Creates a generic IndirectEntityDamageOriginBuilder with an entity and a direct entity related to the damage. In this case for example with projectile, the direct source will be the projectile and the source will be the thrower.
      Parameters:
      name - The name, or by default the translation key used for death message
      directSource - The entity direct source, the nearest entity that will damage the target
      source - The entity source
      Returns:
      A builder to then build a new IndirectEntityDamageOrigin

    • isSweep

      boolean isSweep()
      Checks if this damage is considered as sweep damage. A sweep damage generally hit multiple target in a radius close to the attacker
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for sweep damage

    • isCritical

      boolean isCritical()
      Checks if this damage will do a critical hit or not. A critical hit will generally make some extra damage to the target
      Returns:
      True for a critical damage

    • isFromProjectile

      boolean isFromProjectile()
      Checks if this damage has been created by a projectile. A projectile damage can be mitigated if the target wear an armor using a projectile protection enchantment.
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for damage created by a projectile

    • isFromExplosion

      boolean isFromExplosion()
      Checks if this damage has been created by an explosion. An explosion damage can be mitigated if the target wear an armor using a blast protection enchantment.
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for damage created by an explosion

    • isFromFire

      boolean isFromFire()
      Checks if this damage is considered as fire damage. A fire damage can be mitigated using game-rules, fire protection enchantment and potion. A "fire ignited" sound will be played when the damage will be taken at the target position
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for fire damage

    • isFromMagic

      boolean isFromMagic()
      Checks if this damage is considered as magic damage. A magic damage can bypass armor.
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for magic damage

    • isFromFalling

      boolean isFromFalling()
      Checks if this damage is considered as falling damage.
      Note: A damage can have multiple nature
      Returns:
      True for falling damage

    • willNotAggro

      boolean willNotAggro()
      Checks if this damage will make angry nearby entities of the damage type/variant.
      Returns:
      True for anger damage

    • willScalesWithDifficulty

      boolean willScalesWithDifficulty()
      Checks if this damage amount will be scaled to the difficulty of the world. In vanilla, this concern only the players.
      Returns:
      True for scalable damage

    • canBypassArmor

      boolean canBypassArmor()
      Checks if this damage can bypass armor. If it's the case a target will receive the same amount of damage regardless armor.
      Returns:
      True if the damage bypass armor

    • canBypassMagic

      boolean canBypassMagic()
      Checks if this damage can bypass magic. If it's the case a target will receive the same amount of damage regardless its potion effect and its protection enchantments.
      Returns:
      True if the damage bypass magic

    • canBypassInvulnerability

      boolean canBypassInvulnerability()
      Checks if this damage can bypass invulnerability. If it's the case a target will receive the same amount of damage regardless its state and its protection enchantments.
      Returns:
      True if the damage bypass invulnerability

    • canDamageHelmetArmor

      boolean canDamageHelmetArmor()
      Checks if this damage can hurt the helmet.
      Returns:
      True if the damage hurt the helmet

    • getFoodExhaustion

      float getFoodExhaustion()
      Gets the amount of food exhaustion if an entity take this damage. In vanilla the amount is always equals to 0.1F or null for bypass armor/magic damage
      Returns:
      The amount of food exhaustion

    • getDeathMessageFor

      @Nullable @Nullable Component getDeathMessageFor(@NotNull @NotNull LivingEntity entity)
      Gets the death message for a potential target as a component. This message will be displayed in the chat as a system message and will be visible to everyone connected to the server.
      Parameters:
      entity - The potential target
      Returns:
      The death message as component

    • getName

      @NotNull @NotNull String getName()
      Gets name of this damage origin

      The name can be used as a translation key when no custom death message has been defined If you use the default death message, the name must be a lowercase, camel case and english key.

      Returns:
      The name
